data.title: The educational attainment of second-generation immigrants in The Netherland
meta_keywords: J15; J61; Second-generation immigrants; ethnic minorities; education
authors: Jan C. van Ours & Justus Veenman
data.meta_description: Downloadable (with restrictions)! Since the mid-1960â€™s the Netherlands has had a positive net immigration, mainly because of man power recruitment from Turkey and Morocco and immigration from the former Dutch colony of Surinam. Immigrants havea weak labor market position, which is related to their educational leveland language skills. Children and grandchildren of immigrants are expected to have a better chance of integration into Dutch society. In this paper we investigate whether this is true with respect to the educational attainment of second-generation immigrants from Turkey, Morocco, Surinam and the Dutch Antilles. Copyright Springer-Verlag 2003
